definition[0]: to remove information from a computer memory or recorded sounds from a tape
example[0]: The computer crashed, and all our records were erased.
example[1]: Some of the names had been accidentally erased.
definition[2]: to get rid of something so that it has gone completely and no longer exists
example[2]: Their dream is to erase poverty and injustice from the world.
example[3]: He couldnâ€™t erase the image from his mind.
example[4]: She had tried to erase the memory of that day.
definition[3]: if you erase information on a computer, you remove it
